tags.title: Learning Objective
value: Explain how political, economic, and cultural factors affected society from 1450 to 1750.
Explain the similarities and differences in how various belief systems affected societies from 1450 to 1750.

tags.title: Thematic Focus
value: The process by which societies group their members, and the norms that govern the interactions between these groups and between individuals, influence political, economic, and cultural institutions and organization.

The development of ideas, beliefs, and religions illustrates how groups in society view themselves, and the interactions of societies and their beliefs often have political, social, and cultural implications.

tags.title: Historical Development
value: The Atlantic trading system involved the movement of labor-including enslaved people-and the mixing of African, American, and European cultures and peoples, with all parties contributing to this cultural synthesis.

In some cases, the increase and intensification of interactions between newly connected hemispheres expanded the reach and furthered development of existing religions, and contributed to religious conflicts and the development of syncretic belief systems

tags.title: Stimulus Title
tags.value: Miguel de Estete, Spanish mercenary soldier, account of an expedition to Peru, 1533
